alert.note: Alert for Northwest Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 4:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Randolph and southern Upshur Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 428 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rock Cave, or 13 miles south of Buckhannon, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eden, Tallmansville, Alexander, Ellamore, Kanawha Head and Alton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away.
